scenario_1.message: Hey AI, I just got a new project deadline next week and it looks like I'll be stuck at the office all night. Any quick tips to keep my energy up without burning out?

Sure! Since you’re working late, try short 5‑minute breaks every hour—stretch or walk around the building. Keep a bottle of water and some protein‑rich snacks (like almonds) nearby. Also, set your phone to Do Not Disturb during the night so you can focus without interruptions.

That sounds practical. I usually think about how stressful it could be if I miss my next coffee break, but that’s just an availability bias from last week’s tight schedule. I’ll stick to your plan and make sure to log off by 11 PM.
Great plan! Logging off early will help maintain your work‑life balance. If you need a quick reminder, set a timer for 10:30 PM to start winding down.

scenario_2.message: I’m planning a weekend get‑together with my close friends in Berlin. I heard there’s a new vegan café that opened last month. Do you think it’s worth checking out?
Based on recent reviews from the past two weeks, the café has high ratings for its plant‑based menu and cozy atmosphere. It could be a good spot for your group.

I usually think it’s a risky place because I’ve only seen a few posts about it, but that might just be my availability bias—everything new feels uncertain. I’ll give it a try and maybe book a table in advance.
Booking ahead is smart. If you’d like, I can send you a confirmation link right now to secure your spot.

metadata.beliefs: Prefers practical solutions over idealistic ones, sees work-life balance as non-negotiable, considers friendships stronger than superficial family obligations.

reasoning: Need two scenarios. Use practical solutions, work-life balance, friendships > family. Availability heuristic bias: rely on recent info. Provide realistic conversation. Return JSON.
